2154.subject: GS
2154.course_title_long: Economic Thought: History and Contemporary Interpretations
2154.descrlong:
Explores political economy from historical, critical, global, and feminist perspectives. Students analyze relationships among economic systems and institutions, as well as cultural, political and social institutions, and a wide array of ideologies. Issues addressed include global economic crises, labor activism, labor migration, government, global civil society, poverty and inequality, imperialism and war, and cultural transformations.  (Credit/ No Credit Available).

(Junior or Senior Standing)
